A recent review of Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4.5 showed that while the model is powerful, the generated code was fairly simple, with only a fraction being complex and unnecessarily verbose.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Govt should refrain from hiking income tax surcharge on super-rich, experts say
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Tax experts advise the government against increasing income tax surcharges on the super-rich or reintroducing wealth tax in the upcoming budget. Such measures could prompt high-income earners to relocate to low-tax jurisdictions, potentially impacting job creation and investment. Experts suggest focusing on administrative efficiency and existing tax enforcement.

articles.summary: India is poised to meet its fiscal deficit target of 4.4 percent of GDP for FY26. Experts suggest the government may even surpass this goal, sending a positive message to international investors about fiscal discipline. Despite a revised nominal GDP growth forecast, absolute figures align with budget estimates. This achievement is expected to bolster confidence in India's economic management.

articles.title: CII calls for value unlocking of PSUs through fast-tracking privatisation
articles.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has urged the government to boost capital expenditure by adopting a strategic approach to privatization for the Union Budget 2026-27. CII proposes a demand-driven selection process, a three-year privatization pipeline, and an institutional framework to expedite disinvestment and unlock significant resources for national development.

Policy support, including tax incentives and streamlined regulations, is crucial for this sector's expansion into innovation and business delivery. States are actively supporting GCCs, with a national policy framework further reinforcing this momentum.

articles.summary: Budget 2026: India may introduce incentive packages totaling up to ₹23,000 crore in the union budget for FY 2026-27 to boost domestic manufacturing of high-value capital goods. Discussions will cover trade, defense deals, and skilled labor recruitment. India seeks broader partnerships to reduce dependence on other nations. German companies see significant opportunities in India's growing market.

articles.title: Trade deals driven by policy, not phone calls: GTRI after Lutnick remarks
articles.summary: A think tank argues that trade deals hinge on policy alignment, not leader calls. This challenges US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick's claim that the India-US trade agreement stalled due to a missed phone call. GTRI asserts that complex negotiations break down over substantive issues like tariffs and market access. The trade impasse reflects hard policy choices, not symbolic gestures.

articles.title: Apparel exporters hanging by a thread amid new tariff threats
articles.summary: India apparel exports: The industry is already under pressure after the US imposed 50% tariffs on India last August, marked by deep discounts, diversion of idle capacity to domestic brands and rerouting of export orders through neighbouring countries.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Capex in the driver’s seat of India’s growth story
articles.summary: Budget 2026: With the FY2027 Union Budget looming, there lies a crucial opportunity for the government to concentrate on amplifying domestic potential and fostering growth. Elevating capital expenditure is key to improving infrastructure and spurring private investments. A renewed spotlight on production-linked incentive schemes can galvanise the National Manufacturing Mission, serving as a lifeline for MSMEs and innovative startups.

articles.title: No call from PM Modi to Trump blocked India-US trade deal, US commerce secy says
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick claimed that a stalled India-US trade deal was due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi not calling President Donald Trump. Lutnick stated the deal required leader-to-leader political signaling, which did not occur, leading to India's discomfort and the lack of a call.

articles.title: Trump's 500% tariff threat more of a pressure tactic: Oil industry
articles.summary: In a striking political maneuver, US President Donald Trump is endorsing legislation that would impose a staggering 500% tariff on Russian oil purchasers. Indian oil executives perceive this as a tactical pressure play in ongoing trade negotiations rather than a serious ultimatum. The intention appears to be to coerce India while nudging Russia towards a more peaceful resolution.

articles.title: 2025: A milestone in India-Singapore relations
articles.summary: India and Singapore marked 60 years of diplomatic relations in 2025. High-level visits by leaders from both nations strengthened their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. A roadmap was unveiled to deepen trade and market access. Defence cooperation saw significant engagements, including maritime exercises. Various ministerial and parliamentary delegations also exchanged visits, underscoring the robust bilateral ties.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,750 amid trade pact worries
articles.summary: Indian stocks extended losses for a fourth session on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty falling amid U.S.-India trade deal uncertainty. However, a rebound in the rupee and renewed foreign investor buying offered some support. Global markets also saw declines, particularly in technology shares, while oil prices advanced due to geopolitical tensions.

articles.summary: Differing assessments from US and Indian trade experts suggest that domestic political considerations in Washington and unresolved tariff levels, rather than gaps in negotiations, are keeping the India-US trade agreement on hold, even as official talks are said to be largely complete.

articles.title: Dam Protest 2025: People Demands Development Not Displacement
articles.summary: The overview has some more stories mostly from Madhya Pradesh where dam affected people have been struggling hard to make authorities address their just demands and concerns. MoJS minister has acknowledged non-feasibility of dams   need for work on alternatives. However, the picture on ground is quite the opposite.

articles.title: 2025: People’s Resistance Against Hydro Projects in Himalaya
articles.summary: The Kulsi project in particular has faced strong resistance by tribals groups who are unanimous to get it scrapped. Though the Assam CM in June month hinted at its cancellation but no formal decision has been taken so far. It is worth mentioning that every section of society including villagers, activists, experts, women, students and even political leaders have openly raised their voices against unjustified hydro projects in North East. The year also witnessed mass protests against hydro projec

articles.title: Dec 2025: Vishnugad Pipalkoti HEP Tunnel Accident in Uttarakhand
articles.summary: As per district administration of 60 injured workers 42 were admitted in district hospital Gopeshwar while 17 were under treatment Vivekanand hospital in Pipalkoti. About four-five workers in the district hospital are with bone fracture injuries. Most of the workers received minor injuries while five to six workers suffered severe injuries. Condition of all of the affected workers is reported to be stable. The tunnel work was stopped following the incident.

articles.title: DRP 291225: Looking back on 2025, Looking forward to 2026
articles.summary: On the positive side, if one can call that, the uproar that came against the recent Supreme Court definition of Aravalli hills following a Union government committee’s recommendation provides a faint silver-line in the dark clouds. How useful this will be will depend on the next steps the apex Court takes in the matter after staying its own order of Nov 20 on Dec 29, next hearing to happen in new year on January 21.

articles.title: DRP 221225: Is it so difficult to understand the importance of Aravalli Mountains?
articles.summary: What exactly is driving the unacceptable decision of the apex court? According to the Forest Survey of India, applying the new definition would result in only around 8.7% of the mapped Aravalli landforms being eligible for protection, leaving a substantial portion unregulated.

articles.title: 2025: Pump Storage Projects Developments in India
articles.summary: Most of the PSPs are being proposed in sensitive region of Western Ghats and tribal dominated population endangering both the wildlife and vulnerable population.

articles.title: 2025: Silt accumulation in Indian Dams: Reducing entry of silt is the only viable option
articles.summary: Unfortunately, once silt is inside the large dam storage, there is no economically viable way to remove it. But the governments seem least bothered about reducing the entry of silt into the reservoir by maintaining better catchment health and ensuring that upstream projects do not dump silt into the river. Talking, planning about silt removal from the dams have remained just that so far: Talks. We still lack a national silt management policy and credible action plan.

articles.title: Water and Wastewater Management
Media Resource Centre
India Infrastructures & Ecologies Program
articles.summary: Large infrastructure projects are seen as a critical part of modern societies for the provision of basic services, creation of jobs and to boost economic growth. Infrastructural and industrial projects in modern democracies like India are subject to a complex terrain of federal arrangements, legal compliances, environmental sustainability, cultural appropriateness and public participation. The political and economic importance of such projects also influences legal standards, regulatory practice

articles.title: TREADS: Transboundary Rivers, Ecologies & Development Studies
articles.summary: TREADS programme encompasses and echoes our research and policy interests in transboundary political ecologies, river water governance and development studies. We are interested in politics and ecologies (relationships) across boundaries – after Neil Smith’s “markers of difference” – at different scales. We pursue our interests in this generic sense of transboundary political spaces, at present focused primarily on transboundary river water governance.

articles.title: The Technology & Society Initiative
articles.summary: Recent technology-powered advances – artificial intelligence and deep learning ecosystems, drones, the app economy, blockchain and crypto-currencies, and quantum computing, to name a few – have transformed interactions between States and citizens, and relations inter se private entities and individuals. On the regulatory front, governments worldwide face the unenviable task of directing innovation by optimally balancing risks and rewards. When deployed for governance, technology also raises conc

articles.title: State Capacity Initiative
articles.summary: The State Capacity Initiative at CPR is an interdisciplinary research and practice programme focused on addressing the challenges of the 21st-century Indian state. The purpose of this initiative is to place the critical challenges of building state capacity at the heart of the field of policy research in India, where it has always belonged but remains surprisingly marginalised. We therefore start with first principles and ground ourselves in existing realities to deepen and expand the understand

articles.title: Scaling City Institutions for India Initiative (SCI-FI)
articles.summary: The Scaling City Institutions for India (SCI-FI) programme aims to better understand ‘governance scale’ in Indian cities in tandem with ‘sector specific socio-economic scales’. Through research, the programme aims to inform stakeholders, including the three tiers of the government, to develop better informed policies and programmes enabling improved governance and service delivery. It has two key thematic focus in areas of Land, Housing and Planning, and Water and Sanitation. The SCI-FI programm

articles.title: Land Rights Initiative
articles.summary: India faces serious challenges in constructing development paths that are socially inclusive, ecologically sustainable, politically feasible, and in accordance with the Rule of Law. Current resource intensive growth strategies have caused serious environmental degradation and endangered the livelihoods of many vulnerable groups, particularly the scheduled tribes and other traditional communities. These vulnerable groups rely solely on land and the environment for sustenance. However, underneath

articles.title: Initiative on Climate, Energy & Environment
articles.summary: The Initiative on Climate, Energy and Environment at the Centre for Policy Research (CPR-ICEE) aims to stimulate an informed debate on the laws, policies and institutions shaping climate, energy and environmental governance in India. Our research focuses on an improved understanding of climate, development and environmental challenges – and pathways to improved outcomes – in three key areas: climate policy and institutions, the political economy of energy transition in India, and air quality gov

articles.summary: सारांश: इस लेख में सूर्य प्रकाश यह समझाने की कोशिश करते हैं कि कैसे भारत द्वारा अंतरिक्ष क्षेत्र में लाए गए सुधार, हमारी न्याय व्यवस्था के लिए भी एक मिसाल बन सकते हैं। उनका कहना है कि अगर हमें न्याय व्यवस्था का कायापलट करना है, तो हमें हर न्यायिक संस्था के काम में स्पष्टता लानी होगी, प्राइवेट सेक्टर को साथ लेना होगा और विशेष तकनीकी पद तैयार करने होंगे, बिल्कुल वैसे ही जैसे eCourts Phase III के विज़न डॉक्यूमेंट में परिकल्पित किया गया है।

articles.title: Fast-track courts may not be the cure
articles.summary: The Karnataka District Judiciary Reforms Bill 2025 is the most recent attempt at judicial reform in the state. In 2024, the legislature enacted amendments to the Civil Procedure Code (CPC), introducing case management hearings in district courts, bef...Read more at: https://www.deccanherald.com/opinion/fast-track-courts-may-not-be-the-cure-3816439

articles.title: Karnataka’s new case clock: Can time-bound justice deliver?
articles.summary: The Karnataka government recently passed a state amendment to the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 (CPC) and introduced case management hearings in civil trials. Case management hearings are widely used across the world to streamline court proceedings by setting clear timelines for completing various stages of a case.

articles.title: Civil Disputes, Criminal Justice Resolutions
articles.summary: In this piece, Lakshmi Menon examines how delays, bottlenecks, and weak enforcement in civil courts drive lawyers and litigants to misuse criminal law for quicker settlements. She highlights the unpopularity of civil courts, the systemic nature of the problem and argues that real change lies not in blaming individuals but in pursuing institutional reforms to strengthen our civil courts.

articles.title: Set the guardrails for AI use in courtrooms
articles.summary: In July this year, the Kerala High Court published a set of guidelines for Artificial Intelligence (AI) use by the district judiciary (“Policy Regarding Use of Artificial Intelligence Tools in District Judiciary”). As the first policy in the country directly addressing AI use in judicial processes and setting out strict safeguards, it is timely.

articles.title: Why ICAI’s audit limit is misguided and outdated
articles.summary: From FY 2027, each partner in a CA firm will be allowed to sign no more than 60 tax audit reports a year—a proposal the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) says will “improve audit quality and manage workload.”

articles.title: Mapping Judicial Time: A Two-by-Two Framework for Categorising Listings
articles.summary: In this blog post, Gokul Krishnan R proposes a novel two-by-two framework for categorising case listings in Indian trial courts. The framework classifies listings based on their nature (procedural or substantive) and their effectiveness in advancing cases toward resolution. This approach provides a nuanced understanding of judicial time utilisation, moving beyond traditional definitions of "effective hearing".

articles.title: GST Penalty Notice Set Aside for Lack of Clear Section 122 Jurisdiction: AP HC

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed for Lack of Assessee-Specific Evidence in Penny Stock Case
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that reopening based only on generalized information about a scrip, without independent inquiry or linkage to the taxpayer, is invalid. articles.title: GST Refund Right Cannot Be Curtailed Retrospectively by Amendment: J&K&L HC
articles.summary: The Court held that refund rights accrued before the 2019 amendment to Section 54 cannot be taken away retrospectively. articles.summary: The High Court set aside GST assessment and appellate orders where the date for personal hearing was fixed on the same day as the reply deadline. articles.title: Gauhati HC Set Aside GST Registration Cancellation Subject to Filing of Pending Returns
articles.summary: The High Court allowed restoration of GST registration cancelled for six months’ non-filing of returns. articles.title: Customs: Gold Bar Ordered to Be Released as No SCN Issued Within Time

articles.summary: The High Court sent the matter back for fresh adjudication after a GST demand was confirmed due to non-filing of a reply. Relief was granted subject to partial pre-deposit and filing of objections. The post Madras HC Remanded GST Demand as Order Confirmed due to non-filing of reply appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Adjudication Order Set Aside for Lack of Hearing & for demand exceeding SCN
articles.summary: The court set aside an adjudication order after finding that the confirmed demand far exceeded the amount proposed in the notice. The ruling reiterates that authorities cannot travel beyond the show cause notice while adjudicating. The post Adjudication Order Set Aside for Lack of Hearing   for demand exceeding SCN appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Customs Appeal Rejected as Time-Barred Due to Late Filing After Communication
articles.summary: The appellate authority rejected the customs appeal solely on limitation, holding it was filed far beyond the maximum period permitted under law. The ruling underscores that statutory timelines are absolute and merits cannot be examined once delay exceeds the condonable limit. The post Customs Appeal Rejected as Time-Barred Due to Late Filing After Communication appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Calcutta HC Upheld Income Tax Reassessment as Earlier Order Formed No Opinion
articles.summary: The Court held that reassessment is not barred by change of opinion where the original issue was dropped due to absence of evidence. Subsequent reopening based on new material was found legally sustainable. The post Calcutta HC Upheld Income Tax Reassessment as Earlier Order Formed No Opinion appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Sub-Letting Charges to Industrial Authority Allowable against Rental Income
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that rental receipts could not be shifted to income from other sources without any change in facts. Long-standing acceptance of house property treatment required the Department to follow consistency. The post Sub-Letting Charges to Industrial Authority Allowable against Rental Income appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Smart Robot cannot be Treated as Electronic Toy Due to ADP Functionality
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that an AI-based smart robot could not be classified as an electronic toy when it satisfied the requirements of an automatic data processing unit. Re-classification by customs authorities was set aside for lack of technical justification. The post Smart Robot cannot be Treated as Electronic Toy Due to ADP Functionality appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Cannot Deny Stay Jurisdiction Due to Absence of Demand: J&K High Court
articles.summary: The High Court ruled that the Tribunal cannot refuse to consider a stay application merely because no tax demand exists. It held that the power to grant stay flows from appellate jurisdiction and must be exercised where necessary to protect the appeal from becoming ineffective. The post ITAT Cannot Deny Stay Jurisdiction Due to Absence of Demand: J K High Court appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Barcode Scanners Not Smartphones Due to Ancillary Mobile Features: CESTAT Delhi
articles.summary: CESTAT held that handheld barcode scanners with limited mobile features are not classifiable as smartphones. The ruling restores classification as scanners under CTH 8471 and grants exemption from Basic Customs Duty. The post Barcode Scanners Not Smartphones Due to Ancillary Mobile Features: CESTAT Delhi appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: How Bengaluru court poked gaping holes in ED case against Congress MLA, alleged online betting kingpin
articles.summary: Veerendra was granted bail last week. ED had arrested him in August 2025, and alleged it had unearthed money laundering worth Rs 2,300 crore.

articles.title: HC denies life convict parole for wife’s death, but allows him last rites under police watch
articles.summary: This comes at a time when rape-murder convict, Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim has got parole for the 15th time in eight years. This time, he will be out for 40 days.

articles.title: Cash row: SC disagrees with Justice Varma’s contention that LS Speaker couldn’t have formed probe panel
articles.summary: Justice Varma says that under Judges Inquiry Act if motions are moved before both Houses on the same day, a joint panel should be formed to enquire into allegations.

articles.title: Could’ve been resolved if not for ‘disgruntled elements’. What Madras HC said on lamp lighting row
articles.summary: Madras HC came down heavily on Tamil Nadu administration, saying it was ‘ridiculous and hard to believe’ the state’s fears of public disorder over lamp lighting.

articles.title: In order to regularise 41 daily wage workers, High Court gives Haryana govt a lesson on ‘Rajdharma’
articles.summary: Punjab   Haryana HC went beyond binaries of 'legal vs illegal' appointments to say a State can't invoke procedural technicalities to deny dignity to those who have sustained its functioning.

articles.title: Why Himachal HC granted bail to man accused of sedition over remarks on India-Pakistan conflict
articles.summary: Petitioner’s counsel says the ruling underscores need for judicial caution in cases involving digital speech, especially when it concerns opinions on war, peace   inter-community harmony.

articles.title: SC grants bail to ex-Amtek promoter Arvind Dham, says ‘pretrial detention can’t be used as punishment’
articles.summary: Case against Arvind Dham was initiated by ED, which accused him of establishing around 500 shell companies, with up to 15 levels of indirect ownership, to divert funds.

articles.title: Will have to start from scratch, say medical students after brand new college in Jammu shuts abruptly
articles.summary: Barely months after classes began, MBBS students at Vaishno Devi institute leave as NMC revokes permit amidst protests by Hindu outfits over admission of Muslim students.

articles.title: Reversing brain drain: Modi govt has a ‘scheme’ up its sleeve to get back top Indian-origin researchers
articles.summary: Proposal was presented during IIT Council meeting, with understanding initiative will be launched soon. It will focus on 14 priority sectors including semiconductors   AI.

articles.title: On the cards at IITs: Reforms in MTech & PhD programmes, making JEE-Advanced ‘more student friendly’
articles.summary: IIT Kanpur to outline roadmap to transition JEE Advanced to adaptive testing, which dynamically adjusts question difficulty to better assess student skills while reducing stress.

articles.title: Citing zero applicants, Centre encourages scholars from 4 Northeast states to opt for IKS internship
articles.summary: The six-month initiative supports selected projects with interns receiving a monthly fellowship of Rs 10,000. These six states, UT were chosen after low participation.

articles.title: Amid protests, Centre sends Tezpur University V-C on leave, forms panel to probe ‘irregularities’
articles.summary: The 3-member committee will review the situation at the university, including allegations against V-C Shambu Nath Singh. Protests have been going on since late September.

articles.title: Born in a lab, Indian Statistical Institute helped shape new India. A bill intends to alter its future
articles.summary: Section of faculty, students and alumni oppose MoSPI's draft Bill that seeks to replace Indian Statistical Institute's elected Governing Council with government-nominated board.

articles.title: Centre backs Andhra’s PPP push to build new medical colleges—the model & political row over it
articles.summary: In a letter to Andhra Pradesh's medical   health minister last month, JP Nadda wrote that states, ‘by strategically adopting PPP models’, could accelerate healthcare reforms.

articles.title: Email ID ‘abc@gmail’, ‘111111’ as bank A/C—CAG flags gaps in Modi govt’s flagship upskilling scheme
articles.summary: Audit finds violations in age and education criteria, duplicate photos, unspent funds, and shut training centres in states surveyed; report tabled in Parliament.

articles.title: From new year, NTA to verify candidates in NEET, JEE & other entrance exams with facial recognition
articles.summary: Aadhaar card will be used for verification. Decision taken after a small trial at some exam centres for NEET-UG this year.

articles.title: Jamia suspends professor over question on ‘atrocities against Muslims in India’ in semester exam paper
articles.summary: New Delhi: Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) has suspended a professor from its department of social work over a question he set on “atrocities against Muslims in India  in a semester exam paper. According to university officials, there were complaints over a question in the BA (Hons) Social Work first-semester examination held earlier this week in [ ]

articles.title: The IIM (under)grad is born: India’s B-schools are reinventing themselves & it’s a ‘win-win’
articles.summary: Over the last two years, several IIMs have expanded beyond their flagship MBA programmes by launching undergraduate courses, including one of the older institutes, IIM Bangalore.

articles.title: ‘Brain drain’ is real: For every 1 foreign student, 25 Indians go abroad for studies, says NITI Aayog
articles.summary: Outmigration of skilled students hampers innovation   knowledge creation as well as increases dependency on foreign tech, it asserts, calling for 'internationalisation at home'.

articles.title: UGC tells universities to prevent entry of stray dogs in campus, calls for ’round-the-clock vigil’
articles.summary: Direction is in line with SC's 7 November order asking all states/UTs and Centre to secure educational institutions and other public places from stray canines, says UGC.

articles.title: Recognition, funding, autonomy. Educationists divided over single higher education regulator Bill
articles.summary: Vikshit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill proposes setting up an overarching higher education commission along with 3 councils for regulation, accreditation   standards of universities.

articles.title: Dharmendra Pradhan defends higher education overhaul Bill—‘no threat to autonomy of states’
articles.summary: Union Minister’s remarks come after Oppn parties raise concerns about ‘excessive centralisation’ of higher education in India. Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill referred to JPC.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: Zepto claims Hyderabad accident victim was not its delivery partner
articles.summary: The incident occurred in the city's Mehdipatnam police limits, where a rider named Abhishek, a native of Shekpet, died after his two-wheeler collided with a bus. Police officials said that the victim worked as a delivery rider for Zepto, prompting the Gig Workers’ Union to demand justice and compensation for the family.

articles.title: Meta urges Australia to change teen social media ban
articles.summary: Tech giant Meta urged Australia on Monday to rethink its world-first social media ban for under-16s, while reporting that it has blocked more than 544,000 accounts under the new law. Australia has required big platforms including Meta, TikTok and YouTube to stop underage users from holding accounts since the legislation came into force on December 10 last year.

articles.title: Google's Gemini seeks edge in AI for online shopping
articles.summary: Google on Sunday unveiled a new iteration of its professional Gemini AI suite geared toward online retail, seeking to create seamless interactions for shoppers from product searches to customer service. Walmart said the tool would help it offer products best suited to its customers' needs, more regularly converting product searches into sales.

articles.title: Mixed Q3 awaits Indian ER&D companies navigating auto sector headwinds
articles.summary: Indian engineering service firms like Tata Elxsi, KPIT and LTTS are set for a mixed Q3 due to weak auto demand, though rising R D in EVs and hybrids offers support. Analysts expect modest 1–2.8% revenue growth, with EU-focused companies benefiting more than US-exposed peers. These firms' FY26 growth could reach 15–20%.

articles.title: Anti-money laundering norms up crypto compliance bar
articles.summary: India’s financial intelligence unit has tightened anti-money laundering rules for crypto firms, increasing compliance and security obligations. Mandatory registration, audits and stricter KYC norms may raise costs and slow new entrants. While this could reduce misuse and improve trust, smaller platforms may struggle under heavier regulatory pressure.

articles.title: IT hardware distributor Mitsumi Distribution eyes Rs 1,000 crore India play
articles.summary: Mitsumi Distribution is entering India with a Rs 700–1,000 crore investment over three years to build infrastructure, inventory and logistics. The company will target underpenetrated tier-II to tier-IV cities, avoiding saturated metro markets. Operations have begun in Mumbai, Delhi and Bengaluru, with plans to expand rapidly across smaller cities.

articles.title: IT ministry takes up communications device safety issue; mobile phone players say routine consultation
articles.summary: The IT ministry has taken over discussions on mobile phone and communication device safety from the telecom department under the ITSAR framework. Industry sources say this is a routine consultation with no new mandates. Talks focus on standards for software updates and device source code, ensuring transparent engagement with manufacturers.

articles.title: India tightens crypto noose: Live selfies, geo-tagging now mandatory for users
articles.summary: India has tightened rules for cryptocurrency exchanges, introducing tougher AML and KYC checks. Users must complete live selfie verification, location tracking and enhanced identity checks, while risky tokens and ICOs are discouraged. Exchanges must monitor high-risk clients closely and keep detailed records to combat money laundering and terrorism financing risks.

articles.title: India proposes forcing smartphone makers to give source code in security overhaul: Report
articles.summary: India is reportedly proposing new security rules for smartphones. These rules include sharing source code and making software changes. Tech companies like Apple and Samsung are opposing these measures. They argue the requirements lack global precedent and risk revealing proprietary information.

articles.title: Meta denies data breach of 17.5 million users; asks users to ignore password reset emails
articles.summary: In 2021, Facebook, another Meta company, reported that data of over 350 million users had been exposed from publicly accessible profiles but not breached. Data breaches at other major social media platforms, X and LinkedIn, were reported in 2018 and 2021, impacting billions of users.

articles.title: Under EU scrutiny, Musk vows to release X’s algorithm code every four weeks
articles.summary: This is not the first time X has promised to make its algorithms open source. Elon Musk had made similar commitments in 2022 and 2023. However, the latest publicly available update to its recommendation code dates back to March 2023.

articles.title: ITAT rejects Binny Bansal's 'non-resident' status claim
articles.summary: The Bengaluru bench of the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) has rejected Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal's claim of non-resident status for assessment year 2020-21, thereby denying him the benefit of the India-Singapore Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA).

articles.title: The man who could be Apple's next CEO
articles.summary: Around 2018, Apple weighed adding costly laser tech to iPhones, highlighting the cautious leadership style of hardware chief John Ternus. Now seen as a leading successor to CEO Tim Cook, Ternus embodies Apple’s incremental, profit-focused approach amid succession planning and innovation challenges.

articles.title: Cloudflare threatens Olympic services over piracy fine
articles.summary: US internet company Cloudflare has threatened to pull its services in Italy, including for the Winter Olympics, after being fined 14 million euros ($16 million) for failing to tackle online piracy.

articles.title: Uber Eats driver criticises Tesla Model Y; promotes 1999 Fiat in viral exchange
articles.summary: The driver reportedly told the customer that the two-decade-old Fiat was “built to last” and cheaper to maintain. The post drew mixed reactions, with some users backing the claim and joking that older European models often outlast modern cars because of their mechanical simplicity, while others defended Tesla’s Model Y for its energy efficiency and advanced technology. The debate comes as Tesla has lost its position as the world’s largest EV maker, after sales fell for a second straight year, an

articles.title: Google founders Larry Page, Sergey Brin pull back from California over wealth tax fears
articles.summary: Google founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are reducing their California business presence, moving companies to Nevada and buying property elsewhere, amid concern over a proposed California wealth tax on billionaires. The measure has sparked debate, with tech leaders warning it could drive capital and innovation out of Silicon Valley.

articles.title: TN's iTNT Hub inks pact with XeedQ GmbH for quantum computing programmes
articles.summary: The programme will be anchored by the Tamil Nadu Technology Hub (iTNT), a public–private initiative supported by the TN government that is an emerging and deeptech innovation network that works closely with academic institutions, startups, and research communities across the state. XeedQ GmbH will provide the remote access, quantum hardware, technical expertise, and learning support as part of this engagement.

articles.title: FCC approves SpaceX plan to deploy an additional 7,500 Starlink satellites
articles.summary: The agency said the additional satellites will provide direct-to-cell connectivity outside the United States and supplemental U.S. coverage, which will allow for next-generation mobile services as well as internet speeds of up to 1 gigabit per second.

articles.title: Chinese AI unicorn MiniMax soars 109% in Hong Kong debut
articles.summary: Shares in Chinese AI startup MiniMax soared 109% as it went public in Hong Kong on Friday, raising US$619 million in a sign that strong investor demand is rewarding the country's rapidly developing sector. Friday's shares performance shows investors have a "strong appetite for China's tech sector and the AI story", Gary Ng, senior economist at Natixis Corporate and Investment Banking, told AFP. The whole AI sector is still at an early stage of development, which requires massive investment, he s

articles.title: Grok limits image generation to paid users; not enough, says govt
articles.summary: MeitY's concernThe issue will remain if X continues to allow the generation, hosting, uploading or sharing of obscene and illegal content that hurts the privacy and dignity of our citizens, especially women and children, in any manner

articles.title: Democratic senators demand Apple, Google take X and Grok off app stores over sexual images: Report
articles.summary: Three Democratic ⁠US senators are ‌calling ‌on Apple and ‌Alphabet's Google to remove X and Grok ​from ​their respective ‌app ‍stores ‍over the spread of ‌nonconsensual sexual images of women and ‍minors on ‍the ⁠platforms, ⁠NBC News reported Friday.

articles.title: L&T Semiconductor Technologies forays into cellular IoT module business
articles.summary: The first module, powered by Qualcomm, will be produced in collaboration with Indian EMS partners to ensure scale and quality for deployments in both domestic and global markets.

articles.title: VC firm Andreessen Horowitz raises over $15 billion across multiple funds
articles.summary: The funds, which account for over 18% of all VC funds allocated in the US last year, will be invested in core technology platforms, including AI, cryptocurrency, and others. The geopolitical developments have caused the firm to change its investment strategy to invest in emerging technologies that can compete with China.

articles.title: TSMC fourth-quarter revenue jumps 20%, beats forecasts
articles.summary: TSMC reported a 20.45% increase in fourth-quarter revenue from a year earlier, ‌beating the market forecast, as demand for the company's products leapt in response to surging interest in AI applications.

articles.title: Physical AI dominates CES but humanity will still have to wait a while for humanoid servants
articles.summary: The annual event draws the biggest companies from the global tech and auto industries who this ⁠year underscored the shift from AI software to "physical AI" with robotics, humanoids and autonomous driving technology.

articles.title: China probes competition among food delivery platforms to curb price war
articles.summary: China will investigate cutthroat ‍competition among food delivery ​platforms operated by tech firms such as Meituan ⁠and Alibaba, aiming to rein in price wars that have eroded profits and contributed to deflationary pressures plaguing the economy.

articles.title: EU considers designating WhatsApp as very large platform, spokesperson says
articles.summary: The European Commission is considering recategorising Meta's WhatsApp to make ‌it more responsible ‌for tackling illegal and harmful ‌content, a spokesperson said on Friday.

articles.title: Meta strikes nuclear power agreements with three companies
articles.summary: Meta and other Big Tech companies want to secure long-term electricity supplies as artificial intelligence and data centers increase U.S. power demand ‌for the first time in two decades.

articles.title: Grok turns off AI image generation for non-payers after nudes backlash
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok has turned off its image creation feature for non-paying users following backlash over its use to create sexualized deepfakes of women and children. Some users reportedly used Grok to generate pictures of women and children undressed, sometimes putting them in sexualized positions.

articles.title: SoftBank cuts Ola Electric stake to 13.5% amid continued investor sell-offs
articles.summary: SoftBank has cut its stake in Ola Electric to 13.53% after selling shares over recent months. The offloading comes as major investors trim stake amid regulatory pressure, rising competition and operational challenges. Ola’s market share and valuation also dropped sharply over the past year.

articles.title: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw discusses manufacturing of sovereign, high-end GPUs in India with Nvidia officials
articles.summary: India is stepping up plans to build its own graphics processors after talks between minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Nvidia executives. The discussions covered sovereign GPUs and local manufacturing of advanced AI devices. The government is also expanding subsidised access to GPUs to boost domestic AI development.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI quarterly net loss widens to $1.46 billion: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s AI firm xAI posted a net loss of $1.46 billion for the September quarter, despite revenue almost doubling to $107 million, according to a report by Bloomberg. However, when contacted ‌by ‍Reuters for comment, xAI ‍replied with the message, "Legacy Media Lies." This comes as xAI announced a $20 billion funding round to expand its AI capabilities.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI to build $20 billion data centre in Mississippi
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s xAI plans to invest $20 billion in a vast data centre in Southaven, Mississippi, the state’s biggest-ever private project. The site will host "the world's largest supercomputer" with 2 gigawatts of computing power. The announcement comes as xAI faces scrutiny over its data centre projects in the Memphis area.

articles.title: TikTok picked by FIFA as video content partner at 2026 World Cup
articles.summary: FIFA has named TikTok its first preferred social media video platform at the men’s World Cup. Creators will gain special access and limited match content at the 2026 tournament. This partnership will continue through the end of 2026. FIFA said that the deal builds on FIFA and TikTok’s collaboration for the 2023 Women’s World Cup, which generated tens of billions of views.

articles.title: Apple Card switches hands but no immediate changes for users
articles.summary: Apple has confirmed JPMorgan will become the new issuer of the Apple Card, replacing Goldman Sachs, with no changes for customers. Rewards, savings features and Mastercard access will stay the same during the transition. The deal, closing in about two years, solidifies JPMorgan’s leading position in the US credit card market.

articles.title: EU antitrust regulators to decide on Google's Wiz deal by February 10
articles.summary: EU antitrust officials will decide by February 10 on Google owner Alphabet’s planned $32 billion purchase of cybersecurity firm Wiz. Announced last March, the acquisition secured the US green light in November last year. Tech ‍deals have in recent years faced ‌intense regulatory scrutiny on concerns that dominant companies may further boost their market power.

articles.title: Exclusive: Razorpay invites banker pitches for IPO; targets Rs 4,500 crore fundraise
articles.summary: Razorpay has begun formal preparations for a stock market debut, inviting merchant bankers to pitch for its IPO mandate, people familiar with the matter told ET. The digital payments firm is looking to raise up to Rs 4,500 in fresh capital.

articles.title: China is investigating Meta's latest AI acquisition
articles.summary: China is investigating whether Meta's acquisition of the artificial intelligence startup Manus violated its laws on technology exports and outbound investment. Those rules say that the Chinese government must approve the export of certain technologies, including interactive AI systems.

articles.title: Humanoid robots go for knockout in high-tech Vegas fight night
articles.summary: At a CES-adjacent event in Las Vegas, humanoid robots battled in an Ultimate Fighting Robot match at BattleBots Arena. Controlled by human pilots, the MMA-style fights aim to boost entertainment, attract fans to humanoid robotics, and collect movement data for research and development.

articles.title: Dose of uncertainty: Experts wary of AI health gadgets at CES
articles.summary: At CES, health gadgets promise better heart, fertility and menopause care, but experts warn of shaky accuracy and privacy. As the FDA relaxes oversight under AI-friendly policies, innovators tout access and efficiency, while critics stress bias, data misuse and that consumer tech can’t replace doctors.

articles.title: Gmail's new AI features, turning it into personal assistant
articles.summary: The new AI features announced Thursday could herald a pivotal moment for Gmail, a service that transformed email when it was introduced nearly 22 years ago. Since then, Gmail has amassed more than 3 billion users to become nearly as ubiquitous as Google's search engine.

articles.title: IIIT Dharwad to deploy India's first commercial quantum computer, says Karnataka IT/BT minister Priyank Kharge
articles.summary: The Indian Institute of Information Technology, Dharwad (IIIT-D), will deploy India's first commercial quantum computer at its newly announced Centre for Excellence in Quantum AI and Computing, said Karnataka IT/BT Minister Priyank Kharge.

articles.title: Flipkart appoints Gunjan Bhartia as SVP business finance
articles.summary: The company said that Bhartia will lead business finance for Flipkart's in-house logistics unit eKart across all verticals. He has previously held senior positions at companies such as GE and Coupang.

articles.title: Apple loses Safari lead designer to Browser Company, the firm behind AI browsers Arc & Dia
articles.summary: Apple's senior leadership continues to see significant departures, with its lead Safari designer, Marco Triverio, joining The Browser Company. This move means The Browser Company now employs lead designers from every Safari era overlapping with their Arc and Dia browsers (2020-2025). The company aims to build the industry's most exceptional AI interface and product talent team.

articles.title: Microsoft layoffs: Company denies reports of 22,000 job cuts
articles.summary: Microsoft has denied reports it plans to cut up to 22,000 jobs, calling the claims unfounded. The rumours, which spread online, suggested wide-ranging layoffs across key divisions - gaming, Azure, and sales. While recent job cuts have fuelled scepticism, the company says no such move is planned.

articles.title: Dancing isn't enough: Industry pushes for practical robots
articles.summary: Humanoid robots danced, somersaulted, dealt blackjack and played ping-pong at the Consumer Electronics Show this week, but some in the industry are impatient for them to become more useful, not just a promise of things to come. - According to the Consumer Technology Association that runs CES, the robotics industry is showing dynamism and potential.

articles.title: Europe fills diplomatic agenda for India this week
articles.summary: Europe takes center stage in Indian diplomacy this week. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz visits Monday, seeking trade expansion before the EU free trade agreement. France's Emmanuel Bonne arrives Monday and Tuesday, preparing for President Macron's February trip. Poland's foreign minister Radosław Sikorski follows. Prime Minister Modi meets Merz in Ahmedabad to boost cooperation.

articles.title: Budget 2026: As economy holds firm, India Inc urges focus on growth, capex and private investment
articles.summary: Businesses in India are urging the government to prioritize economic growth in the upcoming budget. They are calling for more reforms and increased government spending on infrastructure. Incentives for private investment and privatization are also key demands. Support for exporters facing challenges from US tariffs is crucial. The budget is expected to outline the path for future economic expansion.

articles.title: Credit demand zooms as policy eases, outstanding bank credit crossed Rs 200 lakh cr for the first time on Dec 31, 2025
articles.summary: India's credit demand is surging. Lower taxes and supportive monetary policy are fueling investment. Outstanding bank credit has crossed a major milestone. This growth surpasses projections, indicating a strong economic rebound. Auto loans, small and mid-sized companies, and home loans are key drivers. Investment intentions are translating into spending, creating a positive environment.

articles.title: Budget 2026: CII seeks rolling, 3-year pipeline for privatisation
articles.summary: Budget FY26 expectations: The Confederation of Indian Industry suggests a three-year plan for selling stakes in government companies. This strategy aims to speed up privatisation. The industry body estimates a significant amount could be raised to fuel development. The proposal includes gauging investor interest first and then prioritising companies.

articles.title: State capex loans cross 56% of FY26 target by Jan 5; Centre aims for full utilisation
articles.summary: The Centre has released over ₹83,000 crore to states for capital investment. This is part of the special assistance scheme for capital investment. The government is confident of fully utilizing the allocation by the fiscal year end. The scheme provides interest-free loans to states for capital expenditure.

articles.title: Spain, Germany, Belgium, Poland emerging as key export destinations for India within EU
articles.summary: India's exports to European Union are showing strong growth. Spain is a standout market with significant export increases. Germany continues to be a stable destination for Indian products. Belgium and Poland also show positive export trends. These developments are occurring as India and the EU negotiate a free trade agreement, promising further bilateral trade growth.

articles.title: Explainer: Simplified Income Tax Act, 2025, to come into force from April 1
articles.summary: A new Income Tax Act, 2025, will replace the 1961 law on April 1, simplifying direct tax legislation and reducing its volume by 50%. The revenue-neutral act eliminates the distinction between assessment and previous years, introducing a single 'tax year' framework. Budget 2026-27 changes will be incorporated.

articles.title: Budget 2026-27: In the AI race, India can't afford to jog
articles.summary: India's digital sector is emerging as a crucial "power-lifter" amidst global economic realignments, strengthening domestic resilience and expanding its international footprint. With significant investments in infrastructure and deep technology, India is poised to convert its digital scale into sustained leadership, leveraging its complex ecosystem for AI innovation and securing infrastructure sovereignty.

articles.title: India eyes new markets with US trade deal limbo
articles.summary: India is aggressively seeking trade deals to open markets for exporters and soften the blow of steep US tariffs, as efforts to secure an agreement with Washington remain elusive. And while a free trade agreement (FTA) with New Zealand added little to Indian export growth, it secured $20 billion in foreign investment, increased visa access and showed Washington that New Delhi is willing to compromise.

articles.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw likely to attend US critical minerals meet amid China’s supply-chain weaponisation
articles.summary: India is set to participate in a key US-organized meet on critical minerals, with Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw likely to represent the nation. This engagement signals a broader US effort to diversify supply chains away from China's dominance. India will also join the US-led Pax Silica initiative ahead of its AI summit.

articles.title: Budget 2026: States seek higher capex aid, GST loss compensation in pre-Budget talks with Sitharaman
articles.summary: States met with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman ahead of the FY27 budget. They asked for more special assistance for capital investments and help with GST revenue losses. Increased funding for urban and rural schemes was also requested. Support for housing programs and disaster management was highlighted. The minister urged states to undertake reforms for India's developed nation goal by 2047.

articles.title: India, EU FTA talks: ministers say good progress made, full steam in coming days
articles.summary: India and the European Union are moving closer to a free trade agreement. Discussions in Brussels showed good progress with fewer issues remaining. Both sides are committed to a fair and ambitious deal. Negotiations are speeding up to finalize the pact soon. This agreement is crucial for economic ties between India and the EU.

articles.title: India’s record rice crop is set to deepen slide in global prices
articles.summary: India's record rice harvest is flooding the global market, pressuring prices as demand weakens and key buyers impose stricter import rules. Farmers may face significant rate cuts to compete with rivals like Thailand and Vietnam. Analysts predict a potential drop of $15 to $25 per ton by spring due to a lack of immediate African and Middle Eastern interest.

articles.title: India's 2025 rice exports surge to near record as curbs lifted
articles.summary: India’s rice exports rose 19.4% last year to 21.55 million tonnes, the second-highest level on record, after the government lifted all export curbs. Officials said shipments recovered quickly from March as supplies improved on record production and the last restrictions imposed in 2022–23 were removed.

articles.title: Telangana govt to promote $3 trillion economy goal at WEF Davos 2026
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy said the state will actively promote its Telangana Rising 2047 vision and aim for a $3 trillion economy at the World Economic Forum in Davos 2026. The delegation will showcase the state’s transformative growth plans, revisit past investment commitments, and highlight opportunities in innovation, technology, and inclusive development.

articles.title: PM Modi made eight calls in 2025: India rejects US claim on trade deal delay
articles.summary: Modi and Trump have spoken on the phone “on eight occasions during 2025, covering different aspects of our wide-ranging partnership”, external affairs ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said on Friday. Lutnick had said that India was given “three Fridays” to clinch a trade deal with Washington last year and that Modi had to call Trump to close it.

articles.title: RBI trims US treasury holding to below $200 bn amid gold rush
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced its holdings in US Treasuries. This strategic move sees the central bank increasing its gold reserves. The shift aims to diversify foreign exchange reserves. This diversification is a response to global economic uncertainties. India joins other nations in this trend. The RBI's forex reserves remain stable overall.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India may peg nominal growth for FY27 at 10%
articles.summary: Union Budget of India: India's upcoming budget may target a nominal growth rate of around 10 percent. This is an increase from the estimated 8 percent for the current fiscal year. Economic growth is expected to remain strong. Inflation is also projected to rise in the next fiscal year due to base effects.

articles.title: Financial Services secretary flags digital risks, says AI key to tackling mule accounts
articles.summary: The central bank has introduced initiatives such as MuleHunter.ai to combat mule accounts used for fraudulent transactions. The AI tool delivers high accuracy and precision with significantly low false-positive rates and is currently deployed across 20 commercial banks.

articles.title: In a fragmenting world, India backs rules-based global economic system, says Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Delivering the first Bibek Debroy Memorial Lecture on the them Indian Economy: A Story of Rising Credibility, Shaktikanta Das, principal secretary 2 to prime minister, said the global economy is at an inflection point, with geopolitical rivalries, protectionist trade policies and weakening multilateral institutions reshaping cross-border commerce and investment flows.

articles.title: Budget Session 2026 to start from January 28, confirms Kiren Rijiju; Budget presentation likely on Feb 1
articles.summary: Budget Session will start on 28 January 2026 and continue till 2 April 2026. President Droupadi Murmu has approved the summoning of Parliament for the Budget Session 2026 and the Union Budget is likely be presented on February 1, a Sunday, followed by a recess for committee examinations. The session will reconvene on March 9.

articles.title: RBI deputy governor pitches for collaboration to deal with frauds
articles.summary: T Rabi Sankar said collaboration between banks and central bank owned Reserve Bank Innovation Hub (RBIH) will both quicken and enhance the capability of these risk mechanisms.

articles.title: Ways and Means Advances limit for Delhi govt fixed at Rs 890 cr: RBI
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has set the Ways and Means Advances limit for the Delhi government at Rs 890 crore. This move will assist the city government in managing temporary gaps between its income and expenses. The central bank will also conduct the Delhi government's general banking business starting January 09, 2026.

articles.title: Budget 2026: PHDCCI recommends reform agenda as spotlight falls on banks, MSMEs
articles.summary: Budget 2026: India's industry body PHDCCI anticipates new government reforms. These include deeper divestment and privatization of public sector enterprises. The aim is to boost corporate activity and protect the economy from export uncertainty. The upcoming budget may clarify the future of public sector banks. Reforms are also expected to support MSMEs and the financial sector.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves fall $9.8 billion to $686.8 billion in first week of 2026
articles.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves saw a significant drop of $9.809 billion. Reserves stood at $686.801 billion in the week ending January 02, 2026. This follows a rise in the previous week. Foreign currency assets and gold reserves also decreased. The Reserve Bank of India monitors these movements closely.

articles.title: Digital frauds: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra calls for collaboration between regulator, regulated to protect customers
articles.summary: While telling banks and other regulated entities to continue to improve their tools, techniques and processes in preventing and tackling digital frauds, Malhotra urged for collaborations in building analytics and tools to detect mule accounts and suspicious transactions timely and pre-emptively.

articles.title: India to focus on skilled jobs, employment quality to achieve inclusive growth: EAC-PM chief S Mahendra Dev
articles.summary: India is shifting its focus towards generating skilled employment and improving job quality, an essential step for sustainable economic development. With a target growth rate of 7.7 percent from 2022-23 to 2025-26, the nation envisions a future where investments, domestic savings, and exports flourish. Emphasizing the manufacturing sector is seen as key to creating more labor-intensive job opportunities.

articles.title: ‘PM Modi and Trump have spoken eight times in 2025’: India rejects Lutnick’s claim that stalled trade talks were due to lack of outreach
articles.summary: India has firmly countered the statements made by US Commerce Secretary Lutnick regarding stalled trade discussions. Officials affirmed that Prime Minister Modi and President Trump are in regular communication, with the Ministry of External Affairs underscoring ongoing high-level interactions.

articles.title: India’s growth miracle in danger? Former CEA warns of tariffs, Chinese imports, and fiscal risks
articles.summary: India's economic landscape is navigating turbulent waters, cautions former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian. He highlights the looming threats posed by US tariffs and competitive pressures from Chinese exports. Moreover, he notes the challenges of domestic fiscal health in this climate.

articles.title: Imbibe spirit of regulations, just don't follow tick-box based compliance culture: RBI Governor to regulated entities
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra called for financial institutions to adopt the spirit of regulations. He stressed collaboration to fight digital frauds. Digital channels offer benefits but also risks. The Governor emphasized partnership between regulators and regulated entities for system stability and consumer protection.

articles.title: RBI MPC 2026: No need to waste bullet when growth high, inflation low, says PwC on central banks's rate cut
articles.summary: RBI Monetary Policy Committee 2026: PwC expert Ranen Banerjee advises the Reserve Bank of India against cutting interest rates. He believes a rate cut now would be a wasted opportunity. Growth is strong and inflation is under control. The Monetary Policy Committee is unlikely to change rates in its upcoming February 2026 meeting. Private investment is not currently driven by interest rates.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman to present Budget on February 1; Parliament session likely from Jan 28
articles.summary: Parliament's Budget session is slated to begin on January 28 with President Murmu's address, followed by the Economic Survey on January 30. The Union Budget will be presented on February 1, a Sunday. Following discussions, Parliament will adjourn for a recess on February 13, reconvening on March 9 and concluding on April 2.

articles.title: India, EU reaffirm farmer, MSME safeguards at FTA talks
articles.summary: India and the European Union are in talks for a Free Trade Agreement. Discussions focus on a modern economic partnership. Both sides aim to safeguard farmers and MSMEs. Negotiations are ongoing to bridge differences. The goal is to conclude the talks soon. This pact could boost Indian exports to the EU market.

articles.title: CPSE Capex reached 74.5% of target by December, set to exceed annual target by fair margin
articles.summary: The Capex for the month of December alone increased by 9.28% to Rs 70,000 crore, with many enterprises exceeding their annual budget target. The growth was led by the Railway board and National Highway Authority of India(NHAI) as they remained the highest spenders.

articles.title: 61,000 crorepati taxpayers added in last one year
articles.summary: India saw a significant rise in wealthy taxpayers. Over 61,000 new individuals joined the crorepati club, bringing the total to 351,000. The number of super-rich individuals, earning over ₹10 crore, also grew substantially. Improved tax compliance and advanced data analytics are credited for this expansion. This trend reflects a growing economy and better adherence to tax regulations across the nation.

articles.title: UN raises India's 2026 GDP forecast to 6.6%, pegs next yr's growth at 6.7%
articles.summary: India's economic horizon shines bright with projections of 6.6% growth by 2026 and 6.7% by 2027, as forecasted by the UN. This surge is fueled by vigorous consumer activity and substantial public investments. With supportive policy initiatives in place, India's position as one of the world's fastest-evolving economies is firmly established.

articles.title: Go Swadeshi: CEA V Anantha Nageswaran calls for urgent indigenisation amid global trade headwinds
articles.summary: The Chief Economic Adviser has spotlighted key industries such as semiconductors, defence production, and critical industrial chemicals for self-sufficiency. Targeting a decrease in import reliance, this plan aspires to elevate India's economic influence internationally.

articles.title: Sensex suffers the worst start to a year in a decade. What this selloff means for investors?
articles.summary: India's equity markets experienced their worst start to a year in a decade as the BSE Sensex fell 1.93% in the first ten days of 2026. Geopolitical tensions, trade deal uncertainties, and sustained foreign institutional investor selling contributed to a broad-based sell-off, particularly impacting cyclical sectors. Analysts advise caution, focusing on quality large-cap stocks amidst expected continued volatility.

articles.title: At record high! Gold prices jump Rs 2,000, silver rallies Rs 10,000: What's fuelling the surge?
articles.summary: Gold and silver surged to record highs as geopolitical tensions, US policy uncertainty and expectations of rate cuts drove safe-haven demand. Analysts flag continued volatility, key support levels and trading opportunities amid heightened global and domestic market anxiety.

articles.title: Hyundai Motor India shares plunge 20% from all-time peak. Will Q3 help turn the tide?
articles.summary: Hyundai Motor India shares are down 20% from peak as GST 2.0 benefits remain limited and margin pressures persist. Analysts see Q3 revenue growth support from exports, but caution on demand, valuation and new plant-related costs.

articles.title: India 10-year bond yield drops to 6.50% briefly amid erroneous deal: Traders
articles.summary: India's 10-year government bond yield experienced a sharp, albeit temporary, dip of 14 basis points in early trading, reaching its lowest point since December 8. Traders attributed this significant drop to a 'fat finger error,' indicating an accidental trade that is expected to be reversed. The yield briefly touched 6.4964% before the correction.

articles.title: DMart shares rise 3% as Q3 profit jumps 18% YoY. What should investors do?
articles.summary: DMart shares: DMart's parent company, Avenue Supermarts, saw its stock rise after reporting an 18.3% profit jump for the third quarter of FY2026. Revenue also grew by 13.3%. While profitability improved, concerns exist about slowing growth in some areas. Analysts have varied outlooks, with some maintaining a hold and others reiterating a buy rating.

articles.title: Fed building renovations at the center of Trump's fight with Powell: 5 key things to know
articles.summary: The Trump administration is reportedly threatening criminal charges against Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell over significant cost overruns on the renovation of the Fed's headquarters complex. The project, involving the Eccles Building and the 1951 Constitution Avenue Building, has exceeded its budget by hundreds of millions of dollars due to rising costs and unforeseen issues.

articles.title: TCS, HCL Tech kick off IT earnings today: Why AI matters more than numbers
articles.summary: As TCS and HCL Tech report Q3 results, investor focus shifts from numbers to AI's impact. While traditional IT services face headwinds, AI adoption is expected to drive significant growth and business-accretive deals, potentially revitalizing the sector's trajectory through 2026 and beyond.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO Day 2: Strong GMP at 46%; check subscription status and key highlights
articles.summary: The Rs 1,071 crore Bharat Coking Coal IPO has seen strong demand, getting fully subscribed within 30 minutes on Day 1 and ending the day with an overall subscription of 8.09 times. Retail and NII participation led the surge, while grey market premiums of Rs 11—around 46% above the issue price—signal positive investor sentiment ahead of listing.

articles.title: IREDA shares jump 4% after reporting 15% YoY growth in Q3 PAT, 28% surge in revenue
articles.summary: IREDA shares surged on Monday following robust third-quarter financial results. The company reported a significant 15.4% year-on-year jump in net profit to Rs 1,381.36 crore, with revenue from operations climbing 28.2%. Loan sanctions and disbursements also showed strong growth, highlighting the firm's expanding presence in the renewable energy sector.

articles.title: Will Q3 earnings finally end 6 quarters of pain? 70 stocks to watch out for now
articles.summary: India's Q3 earnings season is set to deliver the strongest profit growth in two years. Brokerages forecast a sharp turnaround after six quarters of disappointing results. Financials and autos are expected to lead the gains. However, export-facing sectors face headwinds. The market is watching to see if this marks a sustained recovery or a false dawn.

articles.title: Market after a rough week: What charts, VIX and key stocks are signalling
articles.summary: Following a significant weekly decline, the Nifty is nearing oversold territory, suggesting a potential short-term rebound. Technical indicators and a possible recovery in RIL offer some optimism, though a sustained drop remains a possibility if key resistance levels aren't breached. Traders are closely watching for market direction.

articles.title: BCOM rebalancing may trigger bullion correction; copper, base metals preferred for 2026: Ajay Kedia
articles.summary: Gold and silver may face near-term volatility as Bloomberg Commodity Index rebalancing triggers $7 billion in potential selling, says Ajay Kedia of Kedia Commodities. While bullion fundamentals remain strong, he warns of profit booking and advises caution on fresh longs, while turning bullish on copper and base metals for 2026 amid easing rates and supply shortages.

articles.title: Adani Ports shares in focus after flagging Rs 1.5 lakh crore investment push in Kutch
articles.summary: Shares of Adani Ports SEZ Ltd are set to be in focus after managing director Karan Adani said the Adani Group will invest Rs 1.5 lakh crore over the next five years in Gujarat’s Kutch region. Speaking at the Vibrant Gujarat Regional Conference, he outlined plans to double Mundra port capacity over the next decade and commission the full 37 GW Khavda renewable energy project by 2030, underscoring the group’s long-term expansion strategy aligned with India’s national development priorities.

articles.title: BHEL among 5 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
articles.summary: As of January 9, several NSE F O stocks witnessed a sharp rise in futures open interest, signalling heightened derivatives activity. Rising open interest indicates fresh positions or expansion of existing bets by traders, reflecting growing participation and stronger conviction around near-term price expectations in select counters, including BHEL.

articles.title: Oil India among 6 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
articles.summary: RSI trending up indicates that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are rising, suggesting strengthening price momentum.

articles.title: Signatureglobal shares sink 7% to 52-week low on soft demand, FY26 guidance at risk
articles.summary: Signatureglobal anticipates missing its financial year 2026 pre-sales target. The real estate developer cited a soft market environment. Pre-sales for the December quarter declined. However, average realisations improved. Collections saw an increase in the December quarter. The company remains confident about meeting collection guidance.

articles.title: Rupee under fresh pressure as Powell-Trump rift feeds Fed uncertainty
articles.summary: The Indian rupee faces renewed pressure as U.S. President Trump's clashes with Federal Reserve Chair Powell escalate. Despite Reserve Bank of India interventions, foreign outflows and dollar strength continue to weigh on the currency. Concerns over the Fed's independence add to market uncertainty, potentially pushing the rupee to test new lows this week.
