Omnipresent humanoid robots, AI innovations at CES 2026 preview world of future
articles.summary: CES 2026, the most powerful tech event in the world, presented by the Consumer Technology Association (CTA), was held across multiple sprawling venues in Las Vegas from January 6-9. The event saw global companies, startups, industry executives and government leaders to "experience the next-generation of tech that will solve global challenges."

articles.title: Security startup Torq raises cash at $1.2 billion valuation
articles.summary: Torq, which is based in Tel Aviv, offers what it says is an autonomous security operations platform designed from the ground up with artificial intelligence. Torq can automate repetitive work using AI agents, like wading through huge volumes of security alerts. That allows employees to focus on more complex, and potentially dangerous, issues.

articles.title: Google teams up with Walmart and other retailers to enable shopping within Gemini AI chatbot
articles.summary: An instant checkout function will allow customers to make purchases from some businesses and through a range of payment providers without leaving the Gemini chat they used to find products, according to Walmart and Google.

articles.title: Behind hyper-realistic AI content flooding all social media feeds
articles.summary: Social media feeds are filling with lifelike videos and images made entirely by AI, often mistaken for real events or people. Experts say platforms promote such content because it drives attention and revenue. However, poor detection, weak regulation and misuse risks, from fraud to misinformation, are raising serious trust and safety concerns.

articles.title: Google teams up with Walmart, other retailers to enable shopping within Gemini AI chatbot
articles.summary: Google is enhancing its Gemini AI chatbot with shopping features, partnering with Walmart, Shopify and Wayfair to enable instant purchases without leaving the app. Recommendations can be personalised based on past purchases, linking to existing carts. OpenAI and Walmart announced a similar deal in October, saying the partnership would allow ChatGPT members to use an instant checkout feature to shop for nearly everything available on Walmart's website except for fresh food.

articles.title: India should prioritise Indic AI models instead of foundational ones: OpenAI researcher
articles.summary: Sushant Sachdeva urged India to focus on AI models for local languages rather than competing with the US and China on large foundation models. He said India can use existing public models to serve its linguistically diverse population. His remarks come as the government and startups boost efforts in homegrown AI development.

articles.title: xAI locked out of Claude as Anthropic enforces competitor rules
articles.summary: Anthropic has blocked xAI from using its Claude AI models after xAI accessed them through the Cursor coding tool, citing rules against aiding competitors. xAI cofounder Tony Wu said this will slow productivity but push them to build their own tools. This comes just as Elon Musk announced that X’s recommendation algorithm will be open-sourced soon.

articles.title: Malaysia suspends access to Musk's Grok AI
articles.summary: Malaysia has blocked access to Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot after it was widely misused to create pornographic and abusive images. Regulators said safeguards were weak, despite earlier warnings, and cited sexualised content involving women and children. Access will return only after changes are made, following similar action by Indonesia earlier.

articles.title: AI pendants back in vogue at tech show after early setback
articles.summary: Pendants and brooches packed with artificial intelligence abounded at the Consumer Electronics show, using cameras and microphones to watch and listen through the day like a vigilant personal assistant. Nonetheless, at the CES show in Las Vegas, gadget makers have pitched AI pendants as note-takers or ways to remember beautiful or important moments of each day.

articles.title: Indian IT leaders focus on agentic AI for growth, majority of them find AI augmenting talent: Survey
articles.summary: Indian IT leaders are embracing agentic AI for business growth. This autonomous AI technology is a top priority, unlike in Western markets. Indian enterprises are preparing for AI-led business models. AI initiatives are enhancing skills and speed, augmenting talent. New roles are emerging from human-AI collaboration. Indian leaders expect significant revenue uplift from AI within five years.

articles.title: AI toys look for bright side after troubled start
articles.summary: Toy makers at the Consumer Electronics Show were adamant about being careful to ensure that their fun creations infused with generative artificial intelligence don't turn naughty. Toy giant Mattel, meanwhile, made no mention of the report in mid-December when it postponed the release of its first toy developed in partnership with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI.

articles.title: China is closing in on US technology lead despite constraints, AI researchers say
articles.summary: China can narrow its technological gap with the US driven by growing risk-taking ‍and innovation, though the lack of ​advanced chipmaking tools is hobbling the sector, the country's leading artificial intelligence ⁠researchers said.

articles.title: India AI Mission fuels startup ecosystem, strengthens push to make India 'global AI producer': Experts
articles.summary: Industry leaders and startup ecosystem enablers have hailed the Government of India's ambitious India AI Mission, calling it a transformative step toward making India a global hub for artificial intelligence by the end of this decade.

articles.title: IndiaAI Mission fuels startup ecosystem, strengthens push to make India 'global AI producer': Experts
articles.summary: Industry leaders and startup ecosystem enablers have hailed the Government of India's ambitious IndiaAI Mission, calling it a transformative step toward making India a global hub for artificial intelligence by the end of this decade.

articles.title: PM Modi tells IndiaAI startups to showcase local AI use cases at February summit
articles.summary: The PM held a closed-door meeting at his residence on January 8 with about a dozen founders from the IndiaAI Mission cohort. Union IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and senior officials of MeitY also attended the meeting. Modi told the founders to develop safe and authenticated AI, prioritising trust, transparency, and watermarking in their models to build user confidence and comply with evolving regulations.

articles.title: Nine ITIs in Odisha to get AI labs: CM Mohan Charan Majhi
articles.summary: Odisha chief minister Mohan Charan Majhi on Friday said artificial intelligence (AI) laboratories are being set up in nine Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs) of the state.

articles.title: Brew, smell, and serve: AI steals the show at CES 2026
articles.summary: AI dominated CES 2026, from voice-controlled espresso machines by Bosch using Amazon Alexa, to personalised perfumes from DigitalScent. Tennis robots from UBTech and Tenniix showcased AI-driven realism in sport and lifestyle tech.

articles.title: AI gobbling up memory chips essential to gadget makers
articles.summary: At the Consumer Electronics Show, gadget makers warned of a global DRAM shortage driven by booming AI demand. Memory prices are soaring, boosting revenues at Samsung Electronics and Micron Technology. IDC says shortages may last into next year, forcing higher prices and fewer device features.

articles.title: Indonesia temporarily blocks access to Grok over sexualised images
articles.summary: xAI, the startup behind Grok, said on Thursday it was restricting image generation and editing to paying subscribers as it tried ​to fix safeguard lapses that ​had allowed sexualised outputs including depictions of scantily ‌clad ‍children.

articles.title: OpenAI, SoftBank invest $1 billion in Stargate partner SB Energy
articles.summary: OpenAI and SoftBank will each invest $500 million in SB Energy to support the energy firm’s growth as a data center developer and operator, the companies said in a statement Friday. OpenAI also said it has selected SB Energy to build and operate its 1.2 gigawatt data center in Milam County, Texas. A single gigawatt is enough to power roughly 750,000 US homes at any given moment.

articles.title: AI comes of age while some of its founders are yet to
articles.summary: The average age of newbies starting up is coming down to 20s with teens, native to disruptive tech, becoming part of conversation.

articles.title: PM Modi to Indian AI startups: Build LLMs for global good
articles.summary: At a closed-door meeting with the top leadership of 12 AI startups, Modi also called for harnessing the transformative technology for public good, with a focus on solving both Indian and global challenges, multiple founders told ET.

articles.title: CES 2026: From digital to physical, AI is touching every aspect of consumer life
articles.summary: The ‘world’s largest tech fair’, as CES is popularly called, delivered a dose of wonder and whimsy, along with futuristic technology, and much AI-powered consumer gear. While technology managed to bring the world together at Las Vegas in the first working week of 2026, geopolitics in this changing global order cast its shadow as well.

articles.title: Why Meta is lining up massive supply of nuclear power
articles.summary: The parent company of Facebook on Friday announced agreements with TerraPower, Oklo and Vistra for nuclear power for its Prometheus AI data center that is being built in New Albany, Ohio. Meta announced Prometheus, which will be a 1-gigawatt cluster spanning across multiple data center buildings, in July. It's anticipated to come online this year.

articles.title: Elon Musk's AI is generating sexualised images of real people, fueling outrage
articles.summary: Late Thursday, the Grok account on X started limiting requests for AI images to site subscribers who pay for certain premium features, according to posts from the chatbot. The change followed a "backlash over its ability to create sexualized deepfakes without consent," the AI chatbot added, but users can "subscribe or switch to the standalone Grok site for similar functions."

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence
The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema
articles.summary: A visually arresting, fiercely polarising action thriller, Dhurandhar transcends propaganda debates through raw performances, brutal choreography, and an uncanny portrayal of familiar worlds rendered disturbingly strange.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the mightiest - Part 8: How to read the yield curve, and use it to gain an edge in the markets
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: Delhi Metro phase 5A approved: 13 stations, 16 km corridor at ₹12,015 crore
Beyond 1 crore WhatsApp bans; Oyo's third attempt at IPO
articles.summary: The government wants to know more about accounts banned by WhatsApp in India. This and more in today’s ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: India’s manufacturing woes: Rahul Gandhi’s prescription for job creation
School assembly news headlines for December 23: Top national, international business & sports updates
articles.summary: Political sparring intensifies with a jibe at Akhilesh Yadav, while a former Trinamool leader criticizes Mamata Banerjee. International news includes NASA's diamond-planet discovery and a former child star's homelessness. Sports headlines feature Usman Khawaja's family facing abuse, and business news highlights soaring gold prices and Thailand's popularity as an Indian holiday spot.

articles.title: Vivek Ramaswamy mauled in MAGA bloodletting as Trump devotees turn on each other
articles.summary: A conservative conference saw prominent MAGA figures engage in bitter public disputes. Vivek Ramaswamy faced backlash for his remarks on anti-Indian hate. Ben Shapiro criticized Tucker Carlson and Candace Owens. Steve Bannon also attacked Shapiro. The event became a spectacle of internal conflict, with accusations of antisemitism and conspiracy theories dominating the proceedings.

articles.title: India fast-tracks key reforms to shield itself from US tariffs
articles.summary: In its final parliament session of the year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government pushed through major economic reforms aimed at boosting growth amid trade challenges. Parliament approved bills allowing private investment in nuclear energy, full foreign ownership of insurance firms, and a unified securities market code.

articles.title: India valuations fair, earnings key to upside over next 12 months: Mark Matthews
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are poised for steady, healthy growth, driven by the gradual payoff of fiscal and monetary stimulus. While global markets face volatility, India's lack of an AI boom may position it as a favored diversification destination for cyclical exposure. Expect earnings-led returns rather than valuation rerating.

articles.title: Catching the Market’s Swing: How traders ride market moves across India, US and global bourses
articles.summary: Swing trading sits comfortably between long-term investing and high-frequency day trading, appealing to market participants who want to capture short- to medium-term price movements without being glued to screens all day.

articles.title: India’s growth story intact despite FII outflows, sentiment the key risk: Jim Walker
articles.summary: Market strategist Jim Walker expresses astonishment at foreign investors selling Indian equities, deeming it a "madness" given India's status as the world's fastest-growing major economy. He believes recent selling is profit-taking, with investors likely to regret overlooking India's long-term fundamentals and domestic growth drivers.

articles.title: India fixes 7.1% interest on special deposit scheme for provident, superannuation, and gratuity funds
articles.summary: The Ministry of Finance sets a 7.1 percent interest rate for Special Deposit Scheme deposits by non-government provident, superannuation, and gratuity funds from January 1 to March 31, 2026.

articles.title: BHEL, ABB India, capital goods shares continue to see selling pressure on China worries
articles.summary: Within the high voltage and extra high voltage space, stocks like Hitachi Energy, GE Vernova T D, CG Power, Transformers and Rectifiers are some active names.

articles.title: Mitessh Thakkar recommends Dabur, Bosch as buys; flags L&T, Jio Financial as sells

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank appoints Anup Kumar Saha as whole-time Director

articles.title: Groww shares can rise another 20% despite post-listing jump, Kotak projects
articles.summary: Kotak's initiation marks the third 'Buy' recommendation on the stock, following Motilal Oswal and Jefferies in recent weeks.

articles.title: MeitY says no plan to seek smartphone source code from Apple or Samsung, clarifies security talks

articles.title: Manappuram Finance shares gain 3% after clarification on Bain Capital deal reports
articles.summary: Shares of Manappuram had declined as much as 10% last Friday after news agency Reuters reported, citing sources, that the RBI has raised objections to Bain Capital's plans to acquire a controlling stake in gold financing company.

articles.title: National Youth Day: A look at why buying insurance early can lower long-term costs
articles.summary: On National Youth Day, experts urge early financial planning for India’s youth, highlighting insurance as vital for long-term security and future aspirations.

articles.title: Donald Trump, the acting president of Venezuela? US president shares cryptic post on Truth Social
articles.summary: In early January, the US carried out a large-scale military operation in Venezuela, code-named Operation Absolute Resolve, in which Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, were captured.

articles.title: Avenue Supermarts shares gain after Q3 EBITDA surprise; CLSA raises target
articles.summary: CLSA has turned bullish on Avenue Supermarts after the margin-led earnings surprise, while Citi stays cautious, flagging risks to the sustainability of recent margin gains amid rising competition and slowing same store growth.

articles.title: Truck speeds through anti-Iran demonstration in Los Angeles, protesters try to attack driver
articles.summary: A U-Haul truck sped through Iranian protest marchers in Los Angeles Westwood, sparking chaos. Police intervened, protesters attacked the driver, and two people declined paramedic treatment.

articles.title: Life insurers post nearly 40% growth in December premiums after GST relief
articles.summary: India’s life insurance new business premiums grew 39.5% in December, driven by LIC and private firms such as SBI Life, HDFC Life, and ICICI Prudential.

articles.title: Vande Bharat Sleeper Express to launch next week: No RAC, higher fares, faster travel
articles.summary: Vande Bharat Sleeper Express launches next week on Howrah–Guwahati route with no RAC, higher fares, faster travel, 16 coaches, advanced features, and quotas for women, senior citizens, and PwDs.

articles.title: Iran protest deaths rise to more than 500, rights group says
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump and his national security team have been weighing a range of potential responses against Iran, including cyberattacks and direct strikes by the US or Israel, according to two people familiar with internal White House discussions who were not authorised to comment publicly and spoke on condition of anonymity.

articles.title: Tejas Networks shares decline over 4% after narrow, but fourth straight quarterly loss in Q3
articles.summary: Tejas Networks' net loss and EBITDA loss were narrower than the previous quarter, while its net debt also saw a decline compared to the same quarter last

articles.title: Lemon Tree Hotels shares rise 4% as Warburg Pincus buys into Fleur; here's what shareholders get

articles.title: Suspected Pakistan drones seen in areas along IB and LoC, India deploys counter-UAS measures
articles.summary: Suspected drones from Pakistan hovered over Samba, Rajouri and Poonch in Jammu and Kashmir on January 11, prompting security forces to launch search operations and fire at the objects.

articles.title: Australia moves India, Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan to highest student visa risk category
articles.summary: The Australian government has upgraded India and three neighbouring South Asian countries to Evidence Level 3 under its Simplified Student Visa Framework (SSVF), an internal risk-assessment system used by the Department of Home Affairs to determine the level of evidence required from student visa applicants.

articles.title: The Wealth Company MF launches Gold ETF Fund of Fund
articles.summary: The Wealth Company Mutual Fund launches Gold ETF Fund of Fund, offering gold exposure via mutual funds. Managed by Niranjan Das, NFO closes January 23, minimum investment is ₹5,000.

articles.title: Emcure Pharma shares fall as 20% outstanding equity frees up for trade with lock-in ending
articles.summary: The expiry of the shareholder lock in, however, does not necessarily imply that all these shares will be sold in the open market. It only means they are now eligible to be traded.

articles.title: NHAI says it sets four Guinness World records on Bengaluru-Vijayawada corridor NH-544G
articles.summary: NHAI set four Guinness World Records on the Bengaluru-Kadapa-Vijayawada Economic Corridor for longest and highest bituminous concrete laying, marking global firsts in highway construction.

articles.title: A $400,000 payout after Maduro's capture is putting prediction markets in the spotlight
articles.summary: The bulk of the trader’s bids on the platform Polymarket were made mere hours before President Donald Trump announced the surprise nighttime raid that led to Maduro’s capture, fuelling online suspicions of potential insider trading because of the timing of the wagers and the trader’s narrow activity on the platform.

articles.title: Asian shares open higher post US gains, oil prices rise
articles.summary: Equities in Australia and South Korea and the equity index futures for Hong Kong increased, taking their guide from the S P500, which was up 0.6% on Friday to close at an all-time high. US equity futures edged lower.

articles.title: Travel Food Services shares worth over ₹10,000 crore to free up for trade today; just above IPO price
articles.summary: Around 87.2 million shares, or about 66% of the company's outstanding equity, will become eligible for trading following the expiry of the lock in today.

articles.title: Trump 'inclined' to keep ExxonMobil out of Venezuela after CEO response at White House meeting
articles.summary: Getting US oil companies to invest in Venezuela and help rebuild the country’s infrastructure is a top priority of the Trump administration after Maduro's capture.

articles.title: Oil climbs, intensifying unrest in Iran spark supply concerns
articles.summary: Brent crude futures climbed 31 cents, or 0.49%, to $63.65 a barrel by 0006 GMT while U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude was at $59.42 a barrel, up 30 cents, or 0.51%.

articles.title: Donald Trump says he and US military weighing 'strong options' on Iran
articles.summary: President Donald Trump considers military and cyber options as Iran faces massive protests, over 500 deaths, and 10670 detentions. Iran warns US and Israel would be legitimate targets if attacked.

articles.title: Waaree Energies, Premier Energies shares gain 3% each on China export policy change
articles.summary: Starting April 1, the Chinese government will remove value-added tax rebates for 249 products, including solar cells, ceramic roof tiles and lithium hexafluorophosphate.

articles.title: Signatureglobal shares fall 6% after co says will not be able to meet FY26 pre-sales guidance
articles.summary: Shares of Signatureglobal had seen a sharp fall last Thursday and have corrected nearly 30% from their recent 52-week high levels of ₹1,365.

articles.title: Nifty F&O Setup: FII longs the lowest in three months; Here's what may happen next
articles.summary: The Nifty 50 index fell over 2.5% last week, marking its worst weekly performance since September last year, mainly due to consistent selling from foreign institutions, who returned after their holiday.

articles.title: US banking groups warn 10% credit card interest cap could be 'devastating' for consumers
articles.summary: US banking groups have opposed President Trump’s proposal to cap credit card interest rates at 10%, warning it could reduce access to credit for families and small businesses.

articles.title: Trump delivers oil warning, suggesting Cuba should strike a deal with US
articles.summary: Venezuela is Cuba's biggest oil supplier, but since the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by U.S. forces, Trump has successfully pressed interim President Delcy Rodriguez to send Venezuelan oil to the United States.

articles.title: PM Modi inaugurates remaining phase 2 stretch of metro service in Gandhinagar
articles.summary: PM Modi flagged off a metro service at the Mahatma Mandir metro station in Gandhinagar, marking the inauguration of the service between Sector 10A of Gandhinagar to the Mahatma Mandir convention centre. This stretch, which covers Sachivalaya complex, Akshardham Temple, old Sachivalaya, Sector 16 and 24, is part of phase II of the Metro service connecting Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar.

articles.title: Inside Tokyo’s ice-cold new year purification ritual at Teppozu Inari Shrine
articles.summary: Worshippers at Teppozu Inari Shrine in Tokyo brave ice-cold water baths on January 11, 2026, seeking spiritual purification and good health in a New Year ritual.

articles.title: Stocks to Watch on Jan 12: ITC, NTPC, Mahindra & Mahindra, Vedanta, Lemon Tree Hotels & more
articles.summary: Stocks including ITC, NTPC, Vedanta, DMart, and Lemon Tree Hotels will be in focus on January 12 on deal announcements, business updates and Q3 earnings.

articles.title: US to push for quicker action in reducing reliance on China for rare earths
articles.summary: China dominates the critical minerals supply chain, refining between 47% and 87% of copper, lithium, cobalt, graphite and rare earths

articles.title: Magh Bihu 2026 Date: Is Bhogali Bihu on January 14 or 15
articles.summary: Magh Bihu or Bhogali Bihu is celebrated with great fervour by the Assamese people. The celebrations begin a day before the Bihu, known as Uruka. Another interesting feature of this festival is the erection of Meji – a towering heap of bamboo, wood and hay.

articles.title: Finance Minister chairs pre-Budget consultation with States, UTs ahead of Budget 2026
articles.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman chaired a pre-Budget meeting in New Delhi with States and Union Territories ahead of the 2026–27 Union Budget, set for February 1, marking her ninth presentation.

articles.title: Shed colonial mindset, trust Indian capability: Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to railway officials
articles.summary: Addressing senior officials at the Ati Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar ceremony, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw laid out a reform-driven roadmap for Indian Railways, emphasising technology adoption, safety, advanced training and wider collaboration with startups to position the national transporter as a global benchmark by 2047.

articles.title: India confident of dealing with headwinds from ‘known, unknown sources’: Principal Secy to PM Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Principal Secretary to the PM Shaktikanta Das highlights India's resilience amid global shocks, outlining challenges and strategies for Viksit Bharat and continued economic growth.

articles.title: Government plans changes to National Highways Act to fast-track road projects
articles.summary: The government is considering amendments to the National Highways Act to ease land acquisition, cut litigation and speed up highway construction, with proposals likely to be tabled in Parliament’s Budget Session.

articles.title: CBIC flags fake GST notices, advises taxpayers to verify DIN
articles.summary: The CBIC on Friday flagged fake GST notices being sent to businesses and asked taxpayers to report such frauds immediately.

articles.title: US adds fewer jobs than expected in December, unemployment rate declines
articles.summary: US job growth cooled sharply in December, with weak hiring, downward revisions and mixed labour signals, even as falling unemployment and strong consumption kept the broader economic outlook resilient.

articles.title: India cuts US Treasury holdings by 21% in 2025, signals reserve diversification
articles.summary: India’s US Treasury holdings fell 21% to $190.7 billion dollars in 2025, reflecting a strategic shift toward gold and non-dollar assets amid global uncertainty.

articles.title: UBS explains why the rupee’s troubles may not be over yet
articles.summary: UBS’s Rohit Arora expects the rupee to remain under pressure, pegging dollar-rupee at 94 for the year due to weak capital flows, current account concerns and a recovering US dollar. He said any trade deal-led support may be temporary, with limited upside for the rupee. UBS remains more positive on the Chinese renminbi among Asian currencies.

articles.title: India’s consumption recovery: When Goldman Sachs expects demand to pick up
articles.summary: Santanu Sengupta, Chief India Economist at Goldman Sachs, said urban credit growth has already started to recover, helped by regulatory easing from the RBI..

articles.title: Why India’s credit system needs accountability in distribution
articles.summary: Loans represent some of the largest and longest tenure financial decisions made by households and MSMEs, yet those intermediating these decisions face no market wide requirements for training, testing or continuing education, notes Shachindra Nath, Founder & Managing Director, UGRO Capital.

articles.title: US Supreme court likely to rule on Trump tariffs today; What is at stake here?
articles.summary: While it is not guaranteed that the Supreme Court will issue its verdict, it has designated Friday as a “decision day” for releasing opinions, and many anticipate that the tariff case will be addressed.

articles.title: Global cooperation showing resilience despite geopolitical headwinds: WEF study
articles.summary: The barometer indicated that the overall level of cooperation has largely been unchanged in recent years, but the composition of cooperation appears to be evolving.

articles.title: Most of Wall Street drifts as defence companies rocket higher
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 109 points, or 0.2 per cent, as of 9:35 am Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 0.4 per cent lower.

articles.title: GDP to grow by 7.5 pc in FY26, says SBI report
articles.summary: The First Advance Estimates released by the National Statistics Office (NSO) on Wednesday put GDP growth in 2025-26 at 7.4 per cent as compared to 6.5 per cent in the previous fiscal. The RBI has projected the growth rate at 7.3 per cent.

articles.title: Sanctions rhetoric vs market reality: Why oil prices may stay soft and Indian refiners could still gain
articles.summary: As Washington sharpens its sanctions language on Russian oil, analysts caution that structural oversupply, rising global inventories and pragmatic enforcement limits are likely to keep crude prices under pressure. For India, the evolving mix of discounted Russian barrels and softer heavy crude markets could translate into steadier feedstock costs and improved refining margins, even as geopolitical risks persist.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EY pitches TDS simplification for ease of doing business, seeks consolidation
articles.summary: EY has urged the government to simplify the tax deducted at source framework by sharply reducing the number of rates and eliminating low-rate TDS on GST-covered transactions, arguing that the current system creates avoidable compliance burdens without adding meaningful oversight.

articles.title: RBI data shows credit card spends growing, but pace moderates after festive season
articles.summary: India’s credit card spending remained in double digits in November despite post-festive moderation, driven by rising card penetration and strong e-commerce demand, while per-card spends eased and public sector banks gained market share, RBI data shows.

articles.title: US employment anomaly, not geopolitics, clouds 2026 global outlook: JPMorgan’s Aziz
articles.summary: Jahangir Aziz, Head of Emerging Markets Economic Research at JPMorgan, warned that without a revival in private capital expenditure, India’s growth will remain dependent on cyclical, government-led stimulus rather than shifting to a sustainable, higher growth trajectory.

articles.title: Substantial rise in wealth of Indian-origin adults in UK over past decade: Study
articles.summary: Median wealth rose "substantially" for Indian-origin adults in the UK even as the wealth gap between ethnic groups in the country widened significantly over the past decade, new research by the London School of Economics (LSE) has revealed.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP estimates hold up as economists assess what lies beneath
articles.summary: India’s FY26 GDP growth estimate of 7.4% reassures economists, but softer nominal expansion, fiscal maths and base effects explain why the headline number only tells part of the story.

articles.title: GDP growth to slip to 6.8% in FY27, limited scope for rate cuts: Report
articles.summary: A report by Goldman Sachs further said inflation is likely to firm up, leaving limited scope for the Reserve Bank to cut rates further.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP at 7.4% looks strong, but economists caution on soft nominal growth
articles.summary: India’s FY26 real GDP growth of 7.4% meets expectations, but economists warn that weaker nominal growth could weigh on earnings, fiscal math and market sentiment despite headline resilience.

articles.title: India’s 'Goldilocks' run to continue for next two years; FY27 growth likely at 6.5-7%: EAC-PM Chair
articles.summary: 'India has entered into FTAs with various trade partners which is contributing to diversification of exports. This adds to the overall resilience of exports,' the EAC-PM Chairman said.

articles.title: Budget 2026–27: PHDCCI calls for easier credit, lower compliance costs for MSMEs
articles.summary: Interest subvention, higher MUDRA limits and tax audit exemption for micro units among key asks

articles.title: India FY26 GDP first advance estimates see real growth at 7.4%, nominal GDP misses poll

articles.title: Govt signals capex push ahead of Budget with new three-year PPP pipeline
articles.summary: Ahead of the Union Budget, the Centre has unveiled a three-year PPP pipeline worth ₹17 lakh crore, signalling a renewed capex push and efforts to crowd in private investment across core infrastructure sectors.

articles.title: Budget flexibility hinges on nominal growth this year, economists caution
articles.summary: Low nominal GDP growth could complicate India’s Budget arithmetic despite strong real growth, with Morgan Stanley’s Upasana Chachra and HDFC Bank’s Sakshi Gupta outlining implications for fiscal deficit, spending and FY27 assumptions.

articles.title: India’s capex revival: Manufacturing, new-age sectors lead as services, infra lag
articles.summary: Economists Teresa John of Nirmal Bang and Sameer Narang of ICICI Bank analyse India's evolving capital expenditure landscape. While private capex is reviving, it's driven by new sectors like renewables, electronics, and data centres, contrasting with previous cycles. Metals are expected to remain a dominant theme, while the government is likely to maintain its spending at 3% of GDP, with a potential focus on railways and defence in the upcoming budget.

articles.title: Quick commerce’s next hurdle is gig worker security, say industry executives
articles.summary: India’s quick commerce boom faces a social security challenge as gig work scales rapidly, with TeamLease CFO Ramani Dathi and Updater Services COO Saravanan CR highlighting the trade-offs between worker benefits, platform costs, and flexibility.

articles.title: Japan's service sector growth slows in December, PMI shows

articles.title: CCI probe finds Tata Steel, JSW Steel, SAIL colluded on steel prices: Reuters report
articles.summary: India’s competition watchdog has found Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SAIL breached antitrust law by colluding on steel prices, a Reuters exclusive reported on Tuesday, exposing firms and executives to potential penalties.

articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, a CNBC-TV18 poll expects FY26 real GDP growth at 7.5% and nominal GDP growth at 8.3%.

articles.title: This one banking ratio is flashing a warning, but not a crisis

articles.title: Rate cuts may revive real estate stocks in 2026: Bernstein’s Venugopal Garre
articles.summary: Venugopal Garre, Managing Director and Head of India Research at Bernstein, said the macroeconomic environment remains stable and the economy is not collapsing, but warned that growth momentum is fading and upside potential is limited. Bernstein projects an 8% upside for the Nifty, with a target of 28,100.

articles.title: Rice exporters seek budget sops, interest subvention to boost competitiveness
articles.summary: Indian Rice Exporters asked Nirmala Sitharaman for tax breaks, interest aid, and freight support in Budget 2026 to boost exports and sector growth.

articles.title: India services PMI slips to 11-month low in December as demand and hiring weaken
articles.summary: The HSBC India Services Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), compiled by S P Global, slipped to 58.0 in December from 59.8 in November. The latest reading also came in below the flash estimate of 59.1. A PMI reading above 50 indicates expansion, while a print below that threshold signals contraction.

articles.title: Payments Regulatory Board: RBI charts vision for 2028 in first meeting
articles.summary: Members discussed the draft Payments Vision 2028, providing strategic guidance to further develop India’s fast-growing digital payment ecosystem where transaction volumes are projected to nearly triple by FY30.

articles.title: RBI to take over Delhi government’s banking operations, manage public debt

articles.title: Adani Group to invest ₹1.5 lakh crore in Kutch, boost energy and port capacity
articles.summary: "We will complete our Khavda project and commission the full 37 GW capacity by 2030, and we will also double our port capacity at Mundra in 10 years,” he said

articles.title: Budget: CII suggests expedited, demand-led approach for privatisation of public sector enterprises
articles.summary: CII urged the government to mobilise resources through a calibrated approach to privatisation, focusing on sectors where private participation can enhance efficiency, technology infusion, and global competitiveness.

articles.title: Himachal's fish production likely to reach 19,000 metric tonnes in FY26: CM
articles.summary: "For decades, Himachal Pradesh has been known as the ’fruit bowl’ of the country, but as of today, it is charting a new course toward becoming a hub of blue prosperity,” the chief minister said

articles.summary: The company is looking for technology tie-ups for various processes, like coal beneficiation and gasification, to produce synthetic natural gas.

articles.summary: The industry body said manufacturers are facing an inverted duty structure on certain inputs where raw materials and services attract higher GST than finished products

articles.title: Signatureglobal Q3 Update: Pre-sales fall 27% YoY, collections rise 14%
articles.summary: The company's net debt stood at ₹1,020 crore at the end of the first nine months of FY26.

articles.title: At pre-Budget meet in Delhi, Sawant seeks equitable Centre-state funding for Goa
articles.summary: ”Goa’s perspectives, demands, and developmental requirements were presented, with a focus on sustaining momentum in critical infrastructure projects,” he said.

articles.summary: Goa recorded 1.02 crore domestic tourists and 5.17 lakh foreign tourists, aggregating to 1.08 crore total arrivals, the state Tourism Department said in its data released on Sunday.

articles.summary: PhonePe PG Bolt now enables secure one-click Visa and Mastercard payments via device tokenisation, improving convenience and merchant success.

articles.summary: The UAE investigation has pointed to gaps in crew coordination, energy management and landing procedures, calling for stronger regulatory supervision and enhanced pilot training to prevent recurrence of tail-strike incidents during critical landing phases.

articles.summary: Manappuram Finance said its Bain Capital–linked transaction is on track, with RBI approvals for management changes received and final approval pending; shares dropped 5.33% to ₹293 on the BSE.

articles.title: Top Stories | Markets' worst week in four months, MF inflows ease, mixed US jobs data & more

articles.summary: Revenue from operations in the quarter under review stood at Rs 938.36 crore as against ₹882.96 crore in the year-ago period, it added.

articles.title: Practical beauty brand Antinorm raises ₹28 crore in seed round, CEO expects 5-10x growth
articles.summary: Backed by Fireside Ventures, Antinorm is betting on multifunctional, climate-focused beauty products to address the needs of time-starved urban women, as the young brand scales its portfolio, deepens customer engagement and sharpens its direct-to-consumer play.

articles.title: Nippon Paint India appoints Sharad Malhotra as new Managing Director
articles.summary: Under the new leadership, Nippon Paint India will consolidate all its paints and coating businesses under a unified operating model.

articles.summary: Embassy Developments recorded ₹1,392 crore in Q3FY26 pre-sales, up 240% QoQ, with collections at ₹415 crore; received RERA approvals for four projects with GDV over ₹12,800 crore and net institutional debt stood at ₹2,939 crore.

articles.title: IGL clears pre-qualification stage for Saudi Arabia gas distribution tender
articles.summary: IGL added that the competition documents for the next stage of the tender will be shared by the Saudi authorities in due course.

articles.title: Vodafone's AGR relief, US Supreme Court on Trump tariffs, Trump on China and Taiwan, Q3 results and more
articles.summary: In today's newsletter, we take a look at Vodafone's timeline on AGR, the US Supreme Court's call on Trump's pivotal tariff regime, Q3 results today, IREDA results, Power Mech's major order win worth over ₹3,126 crore and more. Here is all you need to know with CNBC-TV18's Newsletter

articles.title: Chevron, Vitol, Trafigura vie to control Venezuelan oil exports
articles.summary: Chevron, Vitol, Trafigura and others vie for U.S. deals to export Venezuelan crude as Washington seeks indefinite control after capturing President Nicolas Maduro, reshaping global oil dynamics.

articles.title: China's Anta Sports offers to buy Pinault family's 29% Puma stake: report
articles.summary: Artemis had been expecting any offer for its Puma stake to exceed 40 euros a share, a fourth person with knowledge of the matter told Reuters. All four sources spoke on condition of anonymity because the matter is private.

articles.title: From stigma to scale: How Antara is building India’s senior-care ecosystem

In a conversation with CNBC-TV18, Executive Chairperson Tara Singh Vachani outlines how rising longevity, changing family structures and a growing focus on wellness are driving demand—while regulatory gaps and lack of standards remain the sector’s biggest scaling challenge.

articles.title: Power Mech Projects secures ₹3,126 crore battery storage orders from WBSEDCL
